meta.description: Latest news on GMO food, GMO crops, GMO labelling and genetically modified organisms

title: GMWatch Home
cleaned_text:
"It's important for people to know that these gene edited plants are going into the market" – Prof Jennifer Kuzma

New GM technology has no place in sustainable farming Green MEPs Benoît Biteau and Martin Häusling argue that new GM technology won’t solve the problems of industrial agriculture and will undermine nature, climate protection and the European Green Deal

GMO boosters suffer logic bypass in using COVID vaccines to promote GMO deregulation Authors arguing for deregulation of GM crops and foods fail to mention that vaccines are tightly regulated – scientist



UK: Your food freedom is under threat – Act now! Tell the government not to deregulate experimental gene-edited foods

Co-op is first UK supermarket to reject GM gene-edited crops and animals without safety checks The company has thrown its weight behind the #NotInMySupermarket campaign

DEFRA's evidence-free leaflet is a wish list for GMO boosters and misleads the public

WHO investigation descends into farce in rush to rule out a lab leak While further investigation of a lab leak is rejected, frozen foods are in the frame! Report: Jonathan Matthews



Lack of critical assessment can delay innovation, jeopardise public trust, and waste resources, especially in the Global South, say scientists. Report: Claire Robinson

Did scientists break the law by eating GMO salmon from their research project? Report: Claire Robinson

Profitability and productivity of organic farming can equal other systems – while increasing soil fertility, reducing pesticide use

GMO spin doctors are using coronavirus vaccines to promote GM crops Exploiting the pandemic to market GM crops makes little sense. Report: Jonathan Matthews and Claire Robinson



Could Bayer/Monsanto finally be forced to acknowledge responsibility for the millions of victims of Agent Orange? Jonathan Matthews reports

"Sterile" insects revert back to being fertile, resulting in resistant GM populations persisting in the environment. Report by Third World Network



How to respond to the UK consultation on the deregulation of gene editing Advice to the public is now live

Japan's first genome-edited food, a tomato, gets green light for distribution Tomato is designed to have biological effects on consumers – but there's no safety data or GMO labelling
